course.subject: COMP
course.name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence
course.description: This advanced AI course will cover advanced concepts and techniques in AI.  The major topics will be: problem solving, knowledge and reasoning, planning, uncertain knowledge and reasoning, learning, and robotics.

reviews.author: posij118
reviews.comment_content: This course introduces a wide range of AI techniques, each of them is talked about for a limited amount of time. Students are supposed to write a research paper of 5-10 pages, the result of which does not have to beat state-of-the-art models.
reviews.comment_teaching:
THIS COURSE MISLEADS STUDENTS -- AVOID:

The fact, that students have to write a research paper, isn't wrong per se. However, the students are not informed of this requirement until after the half of the semester.

I believe the students should be informed about the expectations well into the Add / Drop period, so that have the basis to decide whether they should drop this course. However, this course does exactly the opposite -- it lures students in by using the vague word "Project", where the detailed specification of the project should be used instead.
reviews.comment_workload: The assignments are quite straightforward, however the project is much more difficult. There is also a final exam I can't comment on.

reviews.author: Neige(that)
reviews.title: COMP5221 AAI review
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction, Simple agents
Search, PH, A*, SAT, hill climbing, simulated annealing
Game search and hopefully MDP
Multi-agent systems, game theory
Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
KR & R. Reasoning under uncertainty
reviews.comment_teaching: The tone of the instructor is very boring and the pace of the course is very slow.
reviews.comment_grading:
40% 3 homework and 1 project
60% final
The final paper is much harder than homework. So, you need to prepare a lot for the final exam. The mean of the project is 50(out of 108) and the mean of the final exam is 60(out of 100).
A large percentage of people I know got a B or B- because of inadequate preparation for the final exam.

reviews.author: Wilbur
reviews.comment_content: The course content is mostly covered by Berkeley CS188, except the knowledge base. The course talks about rule-based agents, searching (BFS, DFS, A Star), Markov Decision Process, Game Theory, Knowlege Base, and Reasoning Under Uncertainty.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's tone is really flat and dull, which makes you sleepy in class. There were more than 60 students enrolled in this course, but there were only 8 students attending the class throughout the semester. You can see how boring this class is.
reviews.comment_grading: Somewhat good. Although the grade of the final exam may not seem decent (the average is around 60), the overall grade seems fine.
reviews.comment_workload: Moderate. The programming part of the second assignment is the same as Berkely CS188. There is a project, but it's quite simple and only accounts for 10% of the overall grade.

reviews.title: Poor Grade Course!!!
reviews.comment_content:
Most materials are very similar to Stanford CS221
1. Introduction
2. Reactive Agents*
3. Agents that Search*
4. Markov Decision Process and Reinforcement Learning*

5. Introduction to Machine Learning
6. Knowledge Representation and Reasoning*
7. Reasoning Under Uncertainty*
8. Game Theory and Auction*
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teacher's English accent is very terrible and the class is very boring. The teacher is like a reading machine with no ups and downs in voice.
If you listen to Stanford and listen to this teacher, you can see how big the gap is.....
reviews.comment_grading: It was probably the worst rated PG course I know of, with an awful lot of people ending up with B and B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not too heavy, 3 assignments and a project. Most of the assignments can find the answers.
